title: Luxor
summary: Luxor (/ˈlʌksɔːr, ˈlʊk-/;[2] Arabic: الأقصر‎ l-aqṣur, Egyptian Arabic pronunciation: [ˈloʔsˤoɾ], Upper Egyptian pronunciation: [ˈloɡsˤor]; Sahidic Coptic: ⲡⲁⲡⲉ Pape,[3] pronounced [ˈpapə]) is a city in Upper (southern) Egypt and the capital of Luxor Governorate. The population of Luxor is 422,407 (2021),[1] with an area of approximately 417 square kilometres (161 sq mi).[4] It is among the oldest inhabited cities in the world.
